choices.A: inline insertion between the user network switch cluster and the core cluster
choices.D: one-armed insertion from the ACI border leaf cluster
choices.C: one-armed insertion from the core switch cluster
choices.B: inline insertion between the edge router cluster and the core switch cluster

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.

//IMG//


The security team created a new security policy that requires certain types of traffic to be subject to deep packet inspection. The traffic types are:

• internet traffic to application servers
• internet traffic to corporate users
• partner network traffic to application servers
• partner network traffic to corporate users

Where must the next-generation firewalls be inserted to implement the new policy?

discussion.content: Agree with C, for the same reason Alfred12 said, Partner to App and Partner to corp needs inspection which will not happen on core to edge FW enforcement

Selected Answer: B
Answer should be B, inserting the firewall between the edge router cluster and the core switch cluster, to inspect all the specified traffic types for DPI.

Selected Answer: C
but how do you filter traffic from partner users, using the B option?

Selected Answer: B
B seems to be the correct answer. 
However, I think having the firewall in the ACI boder leaf can work, if you want to route traffic from there but no the best option

Selected Answer: D
VxLAN uses L3 overlay. EoMPLS is not L3

comments.content: VxLAN use L3 underlay but EoMPLS is Ethernet overlay MPLS

discussion.content: Why not OTV? I think this should be D for the the requirement of traffic localization.

questions.question_text: An engineer working for a private telecommunication company with an employee id: 1234:56:789 must evaluate connectivity to the new data centre location based on Cisco Nexus 7000 Series Switches. The IP connectivity is already supplied by the service provider. The solution must provide a Layer 2 extension and optimize the traffic localization. Which technology supports these requirements?

An engineer must configure a new maintenance policy that will apply to multiple Cisco UCS domains. The policy must be available for use by service profiles and service profile templates created and managed in either Cisco UCS Manager or Cisco UCS Central. Changes to this policy must be allowed only in Cisco UCS Central. Which policy type must the engineer select to accomplish these goals?

An engineer must interconnect customer data centers by using a 10-Gbps, unicast-only, Layer 3 circuit. The requirement is to stretch the Layer 2 connection over the tunnel, isolate STP traffic, and create more than two million logical network segments. Which solution meets these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Agree, answer is C, VXLAN EVPN is designed for stretching Layer 2 connectivity across geographically separated data centers over Layer 3 networks like the one circuit mentioned.

Selected Answer: C
Answer: option C.
- OTV: Limited scalability upto number of VLANS (4096).
- VxLAN: 16 million + segments possible.

questions.question_text: An engineer must connect a storage array directly to an existing Cisco UCS Fabric Interconnect. The customer requires a solution that provides IP-based storage that does not need to be connected through an external switch. Also, the operations team wants to have the ability to have direct access to the files stored on the storage array from their Linux hosts. Which storage technology meets these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
NAS is wide standard and can use SMB/NFS/iSCSI.
In that case iSCSI is correct answer
I think it's also A. iSCSI

correct answer is A 
SCSI (Internet Small Computer Systems Interface) is an IP-based storage networking standard that allows for the transport of block-level data over IP networks. This enables the use of existing network infrastructure for storage without the need for dedicated storage networks. It also supports direct file access by hosts, making it suitable for the operations team's needs to access files stored on the storage arrayhttps://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/servers-unified-computing/ucs-infrastructure-ucs-manager-software/116082-config-ucs-das-00.html

Selected Answer: D
Agree, right answer is D, NAS as it utilizes IP to connect to the network and provides direct access to files.

Correct Answer is D : NAS
NAS is IP based and provides file level access
